page.title: 09THE NEW ERSKINE LIBRARY
page.content: The new Erskine library was opened on the 4th June, 1985 by the Provost of Paisley. The library has a stock of 14,000 books and 2,000 records and tapes. There is a large selection of books such as, fiction, non fiction, picture books, reference books and career information. Books in large print are available for those with sight difficulties. The library is split into different sections. There is the adult section, junior section, teenage section and the audio visual and reference section. As yet, the library has no computer club but hopes to have one in the future. It has one computer which members may book time on. The library is open six days of the week. It has four full time staff and two part time staff to deal with the many people who will make good use of it.
